SEARCH
Package Domain

Class KeyboardController

java.lang.Object
Domain.KeyboardController
public class KeyboardController extends Object
The KeyboardController class manages the creation, deletion, modification, consultation and evaluation of keyboards. It utilizes an AlgorithmController for generating keyboard layouts and stores the generated Keyboards in a HashMap.

  • Constructor Details

    • KeyboardController

      public KeyboardController(Vector<Pair<String,char[][]>> boards)
      Default constructor for the KeyboardController class. Initializes the HashMap of Keyboards and the AlgorithmController.
      Parameters:
      boards - Vector with all the initial Keyboards.

  • Method Details

    • createKeyboard

      public void createKeyboard(String key, TransitionMatrix transMatrix, Alphabet alpha, String algorithm) throws ContainsKey, IncorrectType
      Creates a new keyboard with the specified key, TransitionMatrix, Alphabet, and algorithm.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the new Keyboard.
      transMatrix - The TransitionMatrix used for generating the Keyboard layout.
      alpha - The Alphabet used for generating the Keyboard layout.
      algorithm - The algorithm used for generating the Keyboard layout.
      Throws:
      IncorrectType - If the algorithm returns an incorrect character positions.
      ContainsKey - If it does exist a keyboard with that key.

    • getKeyboardNames

      public String[] getKeyboardNames()
      Retrieves the names of all created keyboards.
      Returns:
      An array of strings containing the names of the created keyboards. Returns null if no keyboards have been created.

    • getKeyboard

      public Keyboard getKeyboard(String key) throws NotContainsKey
      Retrieves the distribution of characters on the specified keyboard.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Keyboard to be consulted.
      Returns:
      A two-dimensional char array representing the distribution of characters on the Keyboard. Returns null if no Keyboard exists with the specified key.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If a required key is not present.

    • modifyKeyboard

      public void modifyKeyboard(String key, int i1, int j1, int i2, int j2) throws NotContainsKey
      Modifies the specified Keyboard by swapping characters at two positions.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the keyboard to be modified.
      i1 - The row index of the first character position.
      j1 - The column index of the first character position.
      i2 - The row index of the second character position.
      j2 - The column index of the second character position.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If a required key is not present.

    • evaluateKeyboard

      public double evaluateKeyboard(Keyboard board, TransitionMatrix transits)
      Evaluates the specified Keyboard based on a TransitionMatrix.
      Parameters:
      board - The Keyboard to be evaluated.
      transits - The TransitionMatrix used for evaluation.
      Returns:
      A double value representing the evaluation of the keyboard. Returns -1.0 if no keyboard exists with the specified key.

    • getKeyboardDistribution

      public char[][] getKeyboardDistribution(String key) throws NotContainsKey
      Gets the Keyboard Distribution from the specified key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the keyboard to be deleted.
      Returns:
      Returns the distribution of the Keyboard made by a Matrix of Char.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If a required key is not present.

    • deleteKeyboard

      public void deleteKeyboard(String key) throws NotContainsKey
      Deletes the Keyboard with the specified key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the keyboard to be deleted.
      Throws:
      NotContainsKey - If a required key is not present.
